title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: A snowstorm is expected in Boston from late Friday night through Saturday due to an arctic front.
Weather forecasts predict widespread snow accumulations of 2-4 inches, with possible heavier bands in eastern Massachusetts.
Localized ocean effect snow may cause variations, with coastal areas forecasted to receive 3-6 inches of snow.

title: Think you know the Patriots’ Super Bowl history? Take the quiz.
author: Kelly Chan and Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Seattle Seahawks in the Super Bowl this Sunday.
The Patriots famously overcame a 28-3 deficit to win Super Bowl LI in 2017.
A quiz challenges fans' knowledge of the Patriots' Super Bowl history.

title: Patriots star Christian Gonzalez has a big fan in Bruins legend Zdeno Chara
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez honors Boston sports legends with custom-made pregame t-shirts, including Celtics, Bruins, and Red Sox icons.
Bruins legend Zdeno Chara praises Gonzalez for wearing a custom sweater honoring him before a playoff game, strengthening cross-sport camaraderie.
Gonzalez, effective in postseason, allowed only 39.3% completions on 28 targets, the lowest rate for any player with 25+ targets since 2018.

title: Inside the origin of the Patriots’ ‘road warriors’ rallying cry
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots are 9-0 in road games this season, adopting 'road warriors' as their rallying cry.
Head Coach Mike Vrabel, the 2025 NFL Coach of the Year, implemented the 'road warriors' theme using movie and wrestling clips.
For Super Bowl LX, the Patriots chose to wear their white 'road' uniforms, despite being the designated home team.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz for readers to test their knowledge of Greater Boston stories.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
Chianca has extensive experience as a news editor, columnist, and music writer in Greater Boston.

title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri has been elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame, announced during the NFL Honors ceremony.
Vinatieri, the NFL's all-time scoring leader, earned four Super Bowl rings and played for the Patriots and Colts.
Vinatieri is the third kicker in the Hall of Fame, joining Morten Andersen and Jan Stenerud.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP award to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye finished second in NFL MVP voting, one first-place vote behind Rams' Matthew Stafford.
Matthew Stafford received 24 first-place votes (366 points), while Patriots QB Drake Maye got 23 (361 points).
Maye, 23, led the Patriots to a 14-3 record and Super Bowl LX with strong offensive stats.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel named NFL Coach of the Year at the NFL Honors ceremony, his second win after 2021 with the Titans.
Patriots finished 17-3 under Vrabel in 2025, returning to the Super Bowl after two consecutive four-win seasons.
Vrabel praised his team, emphasizing collective effort and accountability as key factors in the Patriots' turnaround.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi openly supports the Patriots in their Super Bowl matchup against the Seahawks, unlike Tom Brady.
Bruschi cites his friendship with Patriots coach Mike Vrabel and team's performance as reasons for his backing.
The Patriots' defense has been strong, allowing the fewest points and yards per game this postseason.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was struck by a police cruiser near the McGauvran Center on UMass Lowell’s South Campus Thursday evening.
The crash occurred around 6:30 p.m. at the intersection of Wilder and Bachelder streets, Lowell police confirmed.
Lowell police and Massachusetts State Police are investigating; UMass Lowell offering counseling for witnesses of the incident.
